body_html:
it looks like the latest clang breaks nvcc again. i have the same problem building:

nvcc fatal   : The version ('80100') of the host compiler ('Apple clang') is not supported

I'm running macOS 10.12.4 with Xcode 8.3.2. Here's more status info:

$ git log -n1
commit feaee29bfe1a021d2368c197f650b70926577ba4
Author: Kai Arulkumaran <Kaixhin@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Sat May 20 08:34:55 2017 +0100

    Add argmax and argmin to docs
$ which nvcc
/Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0/bin/nvcc
$ nvcc --version
nvcc: NVIDIA (R) Cuda compiler driver
Copyright (c) 2005-2016 NVIDIA Corporation
Built on Tue_Jan_10_13:22:46_CST_2017
Cuda compilation tools, release 8.0, V8.0.61
$ which clang
/usr/bin/clang
$ clang -v
Apple LLVM version 8.1.0 (clang-802.0.42)
Target: x86_64-apple-darwin16.5.0
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin
$ xcode-select --install
xcode-select: error: command line tools are already installed, use "Software Update" to install updates

body:
it looks like the latest clang breaks nvcc again. i have the same problem building:

```
nvcc fatal   : The version ('80100') of the host compiler ('Apple clang') is not supported
```

I'm running macOS 10.12.4 with Xcode 8.3.2. Here's more status info:

```
$ git log -n1
commit feaee29bfe1a021d2368c197f650b70926577ba4
Author: Kai Arulkumaran <Kaixhin@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Sat May 20 08:34:55 2017 +0100

    Add argmax and argmin to docs
$ which nvcc
/Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0/bin/nvcc
$ nvcc --version
nvcc: NVIDIA (R) Cuda compiler driver
Copyright (c) 2005-2016 NVIDIA Corporation
Built on Tue_Jan_10_13:22:46_CST_2017
Cuda compilation tools, release 8.0, V8.0.61
$ which clang
/usr/bin/clang
$ clang -v
Apple LLVM version 8.1.0 (clang-802.0.42)
Target: x86_64-apple-darwin16.5.0
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin
$ xcode-select --install
xcode-select: error: command line tools are already installed, use "Software Update" to install updates
```
